Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2008 11:47AM mindy25312 wrote: TenderIsOurMight, Thank you (and bless you) so much for your reasssurances.  It's one less thing to worry about.  Now I'm really annoyed with the dr. that told me this, since it's obviously not true and wonder if I should believe anything he says again.... You're an angel.  Thanks again! Mindy
Posts.Title: Skin punch biopsy - Anyone had one? mindy25312 paradiseflower

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2008 05:51PM mindy25312 wrote: Thanks SO much Rande & Sueps!  I've always said "knowledge is power" so it helps to know the facts!  And wow!  Even a picture!  It doesn't look like anything I can't handle!  I am still puzzled why my gynecologist told me that I could be in pain for years after I said I'd like to have a biopsy for my own peace of mind.  He wanted me to wait for a month to see if the dryness cleared up.  He said that is what he'd tell his sister to do.  Well, I'm not one to wait around.  Oh, BTW, Rande, a dermatologist is one of the docs I've already seen.  He said it was some dry skin and gave me some hydrocortisone cream to use.  However, I believe he would do a biopsy if I asked him to. Hugs & thanks to both of you ladies, Mindy
Posts.Title: Skin punch biopsy - Anyone had one? mindy25312 paradiseflower

Posts.Content: mindy25312 wrote: For my peace of mind, I have decided to go ahead and have a skin punch biopsy to see if I have Paget's Breast Disease.  I have already been to 3 doctors who say that I do NOT have it, but there has been a definite change in color of my right areola, and the nipple is larger on that side.  Because there is no crustiness, oozing, itching, etc. (all the usual symptoms) the doctors are dismissing it as dry skin, etc. One of my doctors made the remark that a biopsy of this type may leave me in pain for years when scar tissue forms.  Has anyone had a problem like that?  I would appreciate hearing your experiences.  Thanks in advance!! Mindy Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Skin punch biopsy - Anyone had one? mindy25312 paradiseflower

Posts.Content: Jun 20, 2008 03:12PM mindy25312 wrote: Hi Rose, Glad that you're now fine!  Thank you for writing.  I have an app't with a surgeon Monday.  This will be my 5th doctor!  You mentioned going to an internist.  Would that be a good type of dr. for this type of thing?  In other words, do you think they would be knowledgable about breast diseases?  I have a question about your symptoms if you don't mind my asking:  Was the little red spot one of the normal little bumps on the areola that looked like it might be infected or was the spot flat? You have really been through a lot with 3 bouts of DCIS!  You are absolutely right:  A patient has to be aggressive especially if she has that gut feeling that I'm starting to have.  Peace of mind is everything. Hugs & thanks, Mindy
Posts.Title: Skin punch biopsy - Anyone had one? mindy25312 paradiseflower

Posts.Content: Jun 15, 2008 04:25PM mindy25312 wrote: Dezzie, Just wanted to write and wish you well on Weds.  The most terrible fear is the fear of the unknown.  You are wise to be getting a mammogram.  Hopefully, you'll find that your fears are unfounded.   Most of what I have feared throughout life has never materialized, and I have wasted many beautiful days worrying needlessly.  Please post again and let us know how things are going. Take care. Mindy
